quote: Where there is love, there is abundance.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Have faith in the universe and its capability to lead you to the path of abundance.
author: Stephen Richards,  Think Your way to Success: Let Your Dreams Run Free

quote: Abundance is looking for you; just open your heart to attract it.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To live a pure unselfish life, one must count nothing as one's own in the midst of abundance.
author: Buddha

quote: Life in abundance comes only through great love.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quote: Be content not with your lot in life but with being here in the flow of life. The glories of creation are in your very cells; you are made of the same mindstuff as the angels, the stars, and god himself.
author: Deepak Chopra,  The Book of Secrets: Unlocking the Hidden Dimensions of Your Life

quote: Everything existing in the universe is the fruit of chance and necessity.
author: Democritus

quote: The entire universe has been neatly divided into things to (a) mate with, (b) eat, (c) run away from, and (d) rocks.
author: Terry Pratchett,  Equal Rites

quote: We are the local embodiment of a Cosmos grown to self-awareness. We have begun to contemplate our origins: starstuff pondering the stars; organized assemblages of ten billion billion billion atoms considering the evolution of atoms; tracing the long journey by which, here at least, consciousness arose.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: Nothing ever invented provides such sustenance, such infinite reward for time spent, as a good book.
author: David McCullough

quote: Nature, it seems, is the popular namefor milliards and milliards and milliardsof particles playing their infinite gameof billiards and billiards and billiards.
author: Piet Hein

quote: Nature is the art of God.
author: Dante Alighieri

quote: To love abundantly is to live abundantly, and to love forever is to live forever.
author: Henry Drummond

quote: ...but I still think that to the unprejudiced, the fossil record of plants is in favor of special creation.
author: E.J.H. Corner

quote: The individual appears for an instant, joins the community of thought, modifies it and dies; but the species, that dies not, reaps the fruit of his ephemeral existence.
author: A.S. Byatt,  Possession

quote: Be a fountain of love, positivity, kindness, and abundance.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: A new consciousness is developing which sees the earth as a single organism and recognizes that an organism at war with itself is doomed. We are one planet. One of the great revelations of the age of space exploration is the image of the earth finite and lonely, somehow vulnerable, bearing the entire human species through the oceans of space and time.
author: Carl Sagan

quote: Each being in the universe yearns for the free energy necessary for survival and development. Each existence resists extinction. The consequent history of violence in the universe is as inevitable as the gravitational pull between the Earth and the Sun.
author: Brian Swimme,  The Universe Story: From the Primordial Flaring Forth to the Ecozoic Era--A Celebration of the Unfol

quote: Blind metaphysical necessity, which is certainly the same always and every where, could produce no variety of things. All that diversity of natural things which we find suited to different times and places could arise from nothing but the ideas and will of a Being, necessarily existing.
author: Isaac Newton,  The Principia: Mathematical Principles of Natural Philosophy

quote: Doing what you love is the cornerstone of having abundance in your life.
author: Wayne Dyer

quote: When man becomes greater than nature, nature, which gave us birth, will respond.
author: Loren Eiseley

quote: Plant seeds of happiness, hope, success, and love; it will all come back to you in abundance. This is the law of nature.
author: Steve Maraboli,  Unapologetically You: Reflections on Life and the Human Experience

quote: Every existing thing is born without reason, prolongs itself out of weakness, and dies by chance.
author: Jean-Paul Sartre

quote: Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.
author: Robin S. Sharma,  The Monk Who Sold His Ferrari: A Fable About Fulfilling Your Dreams & Reaching Your Destiny

quote: Science, like life, feeds on its own decay. New facts burst old rules; then newly divined conceptions bind old and new together into a reconciling law.
author: William James,  The Will to Believe and Other Essays in Popular Philosophy

quote: Even so, I’m somebody.I’m the Discoverer of Nature.I’m the Argonaut of true sensations.I bring a new Universe to the UniverseBecause I bring the Universe to itself.
author: Alberto Caeiro,  The Keeper of Sheep

quote: Dans la nature rien ne se crée, rien ne se perd, tout change.In nature nothing is created, nothing is lost, everything changes.
author: Antoine Lavoisier,  Traité élémentaire de chimie

quote: If you thought you were trying to find out more about it because you're gonna get an answer to some deep philosophical question...you may be wrong! It may be that you can't get an answer to that particular question by finding out more about the character of nature. But my interest in science is to simply find out about the world.
author: Richard Feynman

quote: Life comes from the earth and life returns to the earth.
author: Zhuangzi

quote: The beauty of a living thing is not the atoms that go into it, but the way those atoms are put together.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: I am a conduit of happiness and abundance. It comes to me effortlessly so I can give it away with love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: Nothingwould beeasier withoutyou,because youare everything,all of it-sprinkles, quarks, giantdonuts, eggs sunny-side up-youare the ever-expandinguniverseto me.
author: Kate DiCamillo,  Flora and Ulysses: The Illuminated Adventures

quote: Science, like art, is not a copy of nature but a re-creation of her.
author: Jacob Bronowski,  Science & Human Values

quote: Through endless night the earth whirls toward a creation unknown...
author: Henry Miller,  Tropic of Cancer

quote: What intrigued me more than anything else was finding out the way in which everything, all of creation - all of it! - was held together by invisible chemical bonds, and I found a strange, inexplicable comfort in knowing that somewhere, even though we couldn't see it in our own world, there was a real stability.
author: Alan Bradley,  The Sweetness at the Bottom of the Pie

quote: Earth provides enough to satisfy every man's needs, but not every man's greed.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quote: We are nothing but a few atoms arranged in an intricate organized way.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: And you are made of a hundred trillion cells. We are, each of us, a multitude.
author: Carl Sagan,  Cosmos

quote: Like nature, we must grow with tranquility, beauty, harmony, and love.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: To the untutored sage, the concentration of population was the prolific mother of all evils, moral no less than physical. He argued that food is good, while surfeit kills; that love is good, but lust destroys; and not less dreaded than the pestilence following upon crowded and unsanitary dwellings was the loss of spiritual power inseparable from too close contact with one's fellow-men.
author: Charles Alexander Eastman,  The Soul of the Indian

quote: The Creator has – I say it in all reverence - drawn a myriad red herrings across the track, but the true scientist refuses to be baffled by superficial appearances in detecting the secrets of Nature. The vulgar herd catches at the gross apparent fact, but the man of insight knows what lies on the surfaces does lie.
author: Israel Zangwill,  The Big Bow Mystery

quote: Visible objects therefore do not perish utterly, since nature repairs one thing from another and allows nothing to be born without the aid of another's death.
author: Titus Lucretius Carus

quote: By reading the scriptures I am so renewed that all nature seems renewed around me and with me. The sky seems to be a pure, a cooler blue, the trees a deeper green. The whole world is charged with the glory of God and I feel fire and music under my feet.
author: Thomas Merton

quote: Man is manifestly not the measure of all things. This universe is shot through with mystery. The very fact of its being, and of our own, is a mystery absolute, and the only miracle worthy of the name.
author: Sam Harris,  The End of Faith: Religion, Terror, and the Future of Reason

quote: When the Aggregates arise, decay and die, O bhikkhu, every moment you are born, decay, and die.
author: Gautama Buddha

quote: Every human being is a reflection of this universe.
author: Debasish Mridha

quote: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.
author: Anonymous,  Holy Bible: King James Version

quote: The fact that a cloud from a minor volcanic eruption in Iceland—a small disturbance in the complex mechanism of life on the Earth—can bring to a standstill the aerial traffic over an entire continent is a reminder of how, with all its power to transform nature, humankind remains just another species on the planet Earth.
author: Slavoj Žižek

quote: To put it bluntly but fairly, anyone today who doubts that the variety of life on this planet was produced by a process of evolution is simply ignorant—inexcusably ignorant, in a world where three out of four people have learned to read and write.
author: Daniel C. Dennett,  Darwin's Dangerous Idea: Evolution and the Meanings of Life

quote: If we are merely matter intricately assembled, is this really demeaning? If there's nothing here but atoms, does that make us less or does that make matter more?
author: Carl Sagan,  The Varieties of Scientific Experience: A Personal View of the Search for God
